result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L Johnson

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for James L Johnson.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Back on the record; case not recalled.
At the hour of 4:32 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson submitted the following verdict to the Court:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, James Johnson, GUILTY of First Degree Intentional Homicide as charged in the Information."

"Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 14 day of September, 2022."

and signed by the foreperson

Court polls the jury
Jury panel released from service and out of the box
State's motion for judgment on the verdict; State also requests remand
Defense motion for directed verdict of not guilty; motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict
Court grants State's motion and orders a judgment of conviction be entered into the record

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

PSI not ordered. Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28. Defendant remanded pending sentencing.

Clerk:  jms

Trial continues, same appearances:

1:36 p.m.  Jury in the box
Closing arguments by the State and defense counsel
Court charges the jury
Alternate jurors chosen
At the hour of 2:13 p.m. the jurors retired to deliberate under the charge of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. Bailiffs Bond and Harris, who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Defense motion to dismiss; for reasons stated on the record, denied by the Court.


-----------------------------------------

Back on the record; same appearances
Court has received question from the jury panel and reviews with the parties.
Jury panel not brought back into the courtroom
Court will send a written reply to the jury panel; deliberations continue

Clerk:  jms

Defendant James L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for James L Johnson.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Trial continued. Jury in the box at the hour of 9:50am. Sworn for the State: Ruth Williams. Exhibit # 19 published and received. Detective Martin Saavedra recalled and sworn. State rests. Jury out of the box at the hour of 10:52am. Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify or not to testify. Court find defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to testify. Jury in box at the hour of 11:29am. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Court instructed jury. Court breaks for lunch. Jury out of the box at the hour of 11:43am to return at 1:30pm.

Defendant James L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for James L Johnson.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  1:49 PM.  Jurors out of the box at 3:02 PM. Court and parties discussed strikes for cause on the record. Jurors back in the box at the hour of 3:15 PM. Jurors out of the box at 3:27 pm. Jurors back in the box at the hour of 3:44 PM. 
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense. Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Travis Reszczynski. Sworn for the state: Jermnaine Stephens. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Detective Martin Saavedra. Exhibits 1 - 18  received. Jurors instructed to return at 9:15 am on September 14th, 2022.  Jury out of box at the hour of 4:39 PM. Case adjourned to Branch 28.

Back on the record, case not recalled:

1:49 p.m.  Jury in the box
Voir dire continues

Defendant James L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for James L Johnson.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
11:05 a.m.  Jurors in the box and sworn as to their qualifications
Voir dire commences
Court adjourns case for the lunch hour
Voir dire to continue at 1:30 p.m.

Clerk:

Jury trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case recalled, same appearances:
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Discussion with the parties regarding witnesses and commencement of voir dire
Court rules as to number of convictions of witnesses that may testify.
Parties agree to commence trial on September 13, 2022.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant James L Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for James L Johnson.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
1st call
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
State advises Court that a witness has been picked up on a material witness warrant but may be uncooperative.
Court is in trial on an unrelated case which may be deliberating later today.
Court orders this case passed to 1:30 p.m.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant James L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for James L Johnson.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State advises Court that a witness has been picked up on a warrant but has not yet been processed and has no further update.
Discussion with the parties.
Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
State's Witness List - received
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand  (expires October 11, 2022).

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones (appears via Zoom video), defendant James L Johnson not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.
State advises Court this is a reissue case.
Further, defense counsel advises Court that defendant is requesting a speedy trial demand be entered.
Discussion with the parties whether final pre-trial is necessary.
Court orders case adjourned for jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Watts.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.

Defendant James L Johnson in court, appear by video with attorney Russell J. A. Jones, appear by video.  Defendant James L Johnson in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective M. Saavedra & Detective G. Fraley.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion for substitution of Judge received and filed
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ruth W.

Defendant James L Johnson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant James L Johnson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James L Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter this case has been re-assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
